comments.message: meet minions!

I think it is perfectly fine for people to queue for toys they like. However, there are many who would buy Happy Meals for the toys only to throw the food away. This post is about food wastage. When things like that happen, it is not just a marketing ploy anymore, it becomes a social problem. 

Your company is definitely not earning PR points when the few million other people (not queuing for toys) see massive food wastage. All that it portrays is a company willing to see food thrown away to make that extra few bucks off a craze. 

Your company can argue that (1) it is not a toy company (2) there's a food donation option that few seems aware of, but whether you guys like it or not, people are flocking to your doors because of the toys and not the Happy Meals, so for this promotional period, you are indeed functionally, a toy company. 

So for your own PR's sake, please either highly publicize a food donation option and/or allow the purchase of toys without meals. Even without the meals, you guys will make profit off the low profit margin of the toys anyway. The Happy Meals just sits in the inventory, like any other day. Some other countries are already doing it, so this option not being on the table just smacks of excessive greed. There is nothing wrong with a company making money, just don't create a bunch of problems while you are at it. Please remember, your toys are creating social problems, and you guys better step up and fix it. 

I am very sick of seeing McDonald bringing out the ugly side in people.

2.post_text:
Hi everyone,

Thank you all for your support of the Despicable Me 2 promotion! Do remember that we are offering a deferred fulfilment website where you can order any toys you may have missed out on. Orders will start on 25 July, for delivery in December, and we will post more information here next week. Stay tuned!

On behalf of McDonald’s and MINDS, we’d like to thank all of you who have donated your Happy Meals today. We will upload photos when we deliver the meals, so you can see the kids at MINDS enjoying your kind contribution! We’d also like to thank all our customers for their cooperation in keeping the queues orderly. Please note that our stores may issue queue tickets to keep things running smoothly.

Thank you all for your support! Potato!

3.post_text:
Hi everyone, thank you for supporting the Happy Meal Despicable Me 2 promotion! We know many of you have been requesting the option of donating your Happy Meal(s) to a good cause and we’ve been working on ways to make that happen. From tomorrow 11am till 31 July, we’re pleased to offer you the option of donating your Happy Meal(s) to a charitable partner, the Movement for the Intellectually Disabled of Singapore (MINDS).

Please let our friendly counter staff know you’d like to donate one or more of your Happy Meals when you place your order. The meals will be delivered to MINDS after the promotion is over and McDonald’s will guarantee that they receive a minimum of 1,000 Happy Meals, even if fewer meals are donated.

Mcd needs to explain themselves how the rebate works.

people, please don't get mixed with rebate and discount. this is not a discount card, you won't get the 5% deducted from the amount you pay. it's a rebate. which means you the full amount pay first, and after one month, you get your 5% rebate (you go to the value add machines to get them). 

a minimum of $30 has to be spent in order to qualify for the rebate. and  the rebate is capped at $10 per card, per month. so in other words to get the maximum use of the card, you can spend up to $200 and get the $10 rebate. 

hope this clears the doubts and the thought for people who assume they've been 'cheated'.

9.post_text:
Dear Customers, 
 
We would like as many of you as possible to enjoy the Happy Meal Despicable Me 2 promotion, starting 11 July, 11am. Please be advised that we are implementing the following:

• All new toy designs will be available every Thursday from 11am onwards
• A limit of 3 Happy Meal Despicable Me 2  toys per customer transaction
• This promotion is ONLY for DINE-IN customers and will not be available via Drive-Thru, McDelivery, and Institutional stores.
• For those who might have missed the opportunity to collect their desired Happy Meal Despicable Me 2 toy, we have created a ‘DEFERRED FULFILMENT’ online site for you to place your orders.  However, please be advised that the redemption of these orders will only be fulfiled 4 months from now, in December 2013. For those interested to place an order, please visit http://happymeal.mcdonalds.com.sg from 25 July 2013 - 7 August 2013.

Thank you for your understanding and we apologise in advance for any inconvenience caused.

Yours sincerely,
McDonald’s Singapore

14.post_text:
Dear Customers,

Thank you once again to everyone who has participated in our Hello Kitty Fairy Tale promotion this year. We know many of you have questions about the programme, and we want to address some of the more common queries that we have seen on these pages:

Why didn’t you bring in more Kitties?
We did. We used last year’s Hello Kitty promotion as a guide and brought in 40% more Kitties this year. Why did they run out so quickly? The response from customers and Hello Kitty fans to the Fairy Tale designs has been truly amazing. We will learn from this year’s promotion and it will help us to serve you better in future.

Why don’t you put a limit on the number of Kitties each person can buy?
We know many of our customers buy on behalf of friends, relatives and co-workers, and we wanted to be fair to these groups of people as well. For the Singing Bone Hello Kitty, we set a limit of 4 Kitties per customer. This was mainly to prevent people from buying large quantities of Kitties for resale, and was based on feedback from our customers and our stores. We invite discussion on this and welcome your feedback on what you think would be a fair restriction.

Why did you suddenly introduce coupons?
We have seen public interest in the Kitties grow as the campaign progressed, particularly over the past week. Queues had begun forming at our stores earlier and earlier, and our main reason for issuing coupons is for them to act as queue tickets, so that our customers don’t have to queue when there are no more kitties left. To make sure the coupons are distributed fairly, they are only given to customers who are already waiting in line, on a first-come-first-served basis. This allows us to gauge when stock will likely run out, and our crews can then tell customers further back in line that the Kitties are sold out.

What are you doing to take action against resellers?
We do not support people buying the Kitties for resale, and we have been regularly removing posts offering such services from our page.  We take the conduct of our staff very seriously and if any of them are found to have misappropriated the Kitties for personal gain, we will not hesitate to take appropriate action.

16.post_text:
Dear Customers,
 
We have resumed McDelivery services starting from 6am this morning, and are committed to serving you to the best of our ability.
 
Our main concerns are for the welfare of our staff and the satisfaction of our customers. While the haze persists, we ask for your kind understanding that services may be disrupted or delayed, depending on environmental conditions in different parts of Singapore.
 
We have taken precautions to protect our delivery staff, and our aim is to continue serving you safely and responsibly. 
 
Thank you all for your support.
